intro: Duguetia echinophora, commonly known as the spiny tree or huito, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of yellowish-white flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds. Duguetia echinophora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some indigenous communities.
